    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void alertPlayerOfCheck()
      Cycles through all of the enemies living pieces, finds out if any of their possible moves contains a King, alerts the correct player that they are in check.
      void castle(Piece kingToCastle)
      Asks the player if they want to castle, creates an ArrayList of the rooks that are able to castle, lets the player choose which pawn to castle with, makes the kingToCastle and chosen rook grid location null, resets the kingToCastle and chosen rook's x coordinates to their new locations.
      void endGame()
      Prints each player's pieces that are dead or promoted.
      void gameBoardRefresh()
      Stores each piece in the correct grid location, depending on if the piece is alive, promoted, et cetera.
      void playerKillsAPiece(Piece murderedPiece)
      Sets the victim piece's isAlive to false.
      void playGame()
      Controls the main game loops.
      void promotion(Piece pawnToPromote)
      Asks the player if they want to promote their pawn, sets the pawnToPromote's wasPromoted to true, so that it will not be printed by the gameBoardRefresh(), asks what piece they would like to promote to, creates the respective piece object and places it on the pawnToPromote's current x and y coordinates
      void setUp()
      Instantiates the pieces for players 1 and 2.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        Instantiates the pieces for players 1 and 2. Stores the pieces in their respective ArrayLists. Prints the starting board.

      • gameBoardRefresh

        public void gameBoardRefresh()
        Stores each piece in the correct grid location, depending on if the piece is alive, promoted, et cetera. Prints the board.

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
        Controls the main game loops. Player 1 has a turn, then player 2, then the game asks if the players would like to continue playing.

      • playerKillsAPiece

        public void playerKillsAPiece(Piece murderedPiece)
        Sets the victim piece's isAlive to false. If the victim piece is a king, end the game.
        Parameters:
        murderedPiece - theActivePiece is used for this because at the time, both the attacker and the victim have the same x and y coordinates. The difference is that the victim is in the correct x and y grid space while the attacker is not yet stored in that space. Once gameBoardRefresh() is called, the victim will be not be stored in the grid location and the attacker will.

      • castle

        public void castle(Piece kingToCastle)
        Asks the player if they want to castle, creates an ArrayList of the rooks that are able to castle, lets the player choose which pawn to castle with, makes the kingToCastle and chosen rook grid location null, resets the kingToCastle and chosen rook's x coordinates to their new locations.
        Parameters:
        kingToCastle - Check in Player.canThePieceMove(Piece t) if theActivePiece is a king and if it can castle. If yes, then theActivePiece if passed as this parameter.

      • promotion

        public void promotion(Piece pawnToPromote)
        Asks the player if they want to promote their pawn, sets the pawnToPromote's wasPromoted to true, so that it will not be printed by the gameBoardRefresh(), asks what piece they would like to promote to, creates the respective piece object and places it on the pawnToPromote's current x and y coordinates
        Parameters:
        pawnToPromote - if the the piece from Player.movePiece() is a Pawn and if it moves into an edge of the board, theActivePiece is passed as this parameter.

      • alertPlayerOfCheck

        public void alertPlayerOfCheck()
        Cycles through all of the enemies living pieces, finds out if any of their possible moves contains a King, alerts the correct player that they are in check.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        Prints each player's pieces that are dead or promoted.
